title: Prime Minister of France - Wikipedia
snippet: The current prime minister of France is Sébastien Lecornu who was appointed on 9 September 2025 and resigned on 6 October 2025, but was re-appointed on 10 October.

title: Opinion | France Needs a New France - The New York Times
snippet: In France, it has been a frenzied fall. First, the government was toppled by an irate Parliament. Then, in a panic, President Emmanuel Macron tapped a protégé, Sébastien Lecornu, to be prime minister...

title: France to start 2026 without budget after talks fail | Reuters
